alert.note: Alert for Custer; Kingfisher (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 6:30AM CDT until July 11 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by early morning excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of western and central Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Canadian and Kingfisher. In western Oklahoma, Blaine, Caddo, Dewey, and Custer. * WHEN...Until 930 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 624 AM CDT, Heavy rain continues to move out of the area, but flooding will continue through mid-morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northwestern Oklahoma City, El Reno, Weatherford, Watonga, Kingfisher, Yukon, Mustang, Piedmont, Hinton, Union City, Geary, Okarche, Thomas, Hydro, Cashion, Arapaho, Calumet, Custer City, Bridgeport and Greenfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
